answers.answer: Has anyone ever suggested to you that you have anxiety which BTW can lead to real symptoms even when you don't have those diseases and that you should see a psychologist to help you through this?  You are bouncing from one disease to another and that is no way a 19 year old should be living.  Ask your mom to make an appointment with a psychologist.Try to get the OCD workbook.  You can get it on Amazon or whatever online stores they have in Europe.  You can probably find it in any large bookstore as well.

I have actually walked in your shoes many a time and still occasionally do. I am 23 years old and thought I have had every form of disease possible. Trust me, the best thing you can do for yourself once the blood test results come in and are negative. 1) recognize and accept that you are probably OCD, mixed with anxiety, mixed with depression- which JCF25 suggested can cause and usually does cause your body to simulate similar symptoms of a a disease because your brain is THAT powerful 2) You probably got dizzy and collapsed because you were probably hyperventilating due to anxiety 3) Try to talk to your doctor about medication for depression. It works wonders! You can go to a psychologists, but I would actually recommend a support group with others who have been through the same situation.And if you are like me, practice staying away from google medical aka typing in anything and everything about a disease so your mind can automatically start producing symptoms. That is not a fun path to go down.

I have also been in your shoes.I have self diagnosed many a terrible thing, and everytime I was wrong. I have convinced myself that my moles had turned cancerous, that I had cancer, HIV, diabetes... the list, similar to yours goes on and on. Google, while it is informative is also the devil. For people like us it is really not the path to take. Anything you look up, symptoms wise, can somehow be linked to a deadly terrifying disease in no time at all. And we can convince ourselves that we have these symptoms, we can make ourselves "sick" so between that and the Dr's visit's and the anxiety and the stress we are not really living a happy life are we?I know it is not easy but try to relax. IF there is something wrong with you, you will get through it. I personally think the thing that is wrong with you is your OCD and anxiety... go see the Dr for that. Once you have that under control you will be surprised at how relieved you will be.

Please try to relax, you ar 19 and you will not have any kind of such disease. Please try to relax, tlak to people whom you love and care for you. Just go out and do things, try to control your thoughts.I am no expert I am going through the toughest time of my life but please make an effort to get some professional help.You are alright please go ahead and live your life.GOD Bless

question: I am a complte hypochondriac. I am 19 years old and since I was about 13 I have thought i've had a brain tumor, breast and bowel cancer, heart problems, stomach problems, hormone problems leukemia, diabetes..the list goes on.But i have these worries because all my symptoms are real.Sometime this week I am getting a blood test, because at the weekend I had a dizzy spell and collapsed.I am so terrified they are going to find something wrong with me. I just can't shake the thought of them calling me up saying somethings wrong with me, because i have had so many symptoms.My mum is acting so pathetic, she won't talk to me because she's always angry about something.I'm just sitting in my room crying and shaking i'm so scared, i just know they are going to find something wrong with me.
title: shaking,crying, can't function properly over worrying about blood test.
